addBond

boolean addBond(Bond bond)
Adds a bond to this atom.

Parameters:
bond - the new bond to add

bondIterator

BondIterator bondIterator()
Returns a BondIterator for all bonds in this atom. 
 BondIterator bit = atom.bondIterator();
 Bond bond;
 while (bit.hasNext())
 {
   bond = bit.nextBond();

 }

Returns:
the BondIterator for all bonds in this atom
See Also:
nbrAtomIterator()

equals

boolean equals(Object obj)
Checks if two atoms are equal. Compares hybridization, charge, isotope, atom type and flags, AND atom index number, partial charge and position.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
type -
Returns:

equals

boolean equals(Atom type,
               boolean full)
Checks if two atoms are equal. Compares hybridization, charge, isotope, atom type and flags. When fullComparison is set to false the parent molecule, atom index number, partial charge and position are ignored.

Parameters:
type -
full - When set to false the parent molecule, atom index number, partial charge and position are ignored.
Returns:

getType

String getType()
Gets the type of the Atom. This is the JOELib internal atom type, which can be used via the look-up table in BasicAtomTypeConversionHolder to export molecules to other formats, like Synyl MOL2, MM2, Tinker, etc.

Returns:
the type of this atom

nbrAtomIterator

NbrAtomIterator nbrAtomIterator()
Returns a NbrAtomIterator for all neighbour atoms in this atom. 
 NbrAtomIterator nait = atom.nbrAtomIterator();
 Bond bond;
 Atom nbrAtom;
 while (nait.hasNext())
 {
          nbrAtom=nait.nextNbrAtom();
   bond = nait.actualBond();

 }

Returns:
the NbrAtomIterator for all neighbour atoms in this atom
See Also:
bondIterator()

void setAntiClockwiseStereo()
Sets the 'anti clockwise stereo' flag of the Atom .

setAtomicNumber

void setAtomicNumber(int atomicnum)
Sets the atomic number of the Atom object. E.g.: carbon atoms have the atomic number 6, H atoms the atomic number 1.

Parameters:
atomicnum - the new atomic number
